item.title: Destiny 2: Edge Of Fate Out Now, Officially Kicking Off The Fate Saga
item.content:encoded:
Edge of Fate, the latest expansion from Bungie for Destiny 2 and the first major expansion to kick off a new era of Destiny, the Fate Saga, is out now on all platforms.

The Edge of Fate sees the Guardians getting some help from a new ally, Lodi, as the story centers once again on the Nine, and sees the Guardians dealing with a threat to the universe that goes back even before the Traveler came into the picture. Set in a new location, Kepler, there's plenty of mystery and changes to Destiny 2 coming in this update.

Edge of Fate introduces an overhaul to the armor system with Armor 3.0, a new UI system that's supposed to streamline the experience for players. It also marks the removal of the paywall for seasonal content, and the addition of a new permanent shooting range.

While the expansion is out today for players to check out, the new raid, The Desert Perpetual, will launch this weekend on July 19, 2025.

It's been no secret that Bungie has been struggling recently. While this new expansion offers a chance for the studio to experience a bright spot in their calendar this year, the delay for Marathon, the massive plagiarism scandal around it, and reports of the studio's internal troubles all pointing to leadership; it's clear that the studio desperately needs a win. If only for those developers who have been working overtime to fix the mistakes of their bosses.

Hopefully, Edge of Fate is the beginning of Bungie taking a turn for the better. It's the sign of a healthy industry when a storied studio like Bungie can grow in strength over its many years, instead of dwindling into what many long-time fans fear to be the inevitable, that the studio shuts its doors for good within a few years time.

item.title: CD Projekt RED Will Reveal Yet Another Big Patch For Cyberpunk 2077 This Week
item.content:encoded:
Cyberpunk 2077 is the project that CD Projekt RED just can't put down, as the studio has announced that it is releasing yet another significant update for the game, with Patch 2.3, that'll be revealed in full tomorrow, Wednesday, July 16, 2025, in one of the studio's RED Streams livestream presentations.

It'll premiere at 8am PT / 11am ET / 4pm BST / 5pm CEST, and you'll be able to tune in either on Twitch or on YouTube. The stream will feature PaweÅ‚ Sasko, the associate game director on the upcoming sequel to Cyberpunk 2077, and Adrien Jouannet, the lead designer at Virtuos.

While we don't know exactly what this new update will include, the announcement post on the game's official X account includes a few hints that point to the update specifically dealing with cars in Cyberpunk 2077. "We're driving into Patch 2.3 of Cyberpunk 2077 to check what's under the hood of the newest update," the post reads. It then calls Sasko and Jouannet "passengers," and adds an emoji of a tire to cap everything off.

Beyond this new update, it's already a big week for Cyberpunk 2077, since the game is officially coming to Apple Silicon Mac users this week, on July 17, 2025. Which is the second new platform for Cyberpunk 2077 this year, after it also arrived on Nintendo Switch 2 at launch.

The last time CD Projekt RED reported sales numbers for Cyberpunk, it had sold more than 30 million copies. It'll be interesting to see how many more copies it adds to that milestone, with two new platforms in the mix.

item.title: Grounded 2, Wuchang: Fallen Feathers, RoboCop: Rogue City, Wheel World, And More Added To Xbox Game Pass For July 2025
item.content:encoded:
Xbox has announced the next batch of games being added to its Xbox Game Pass subscription service, with nine titles entering the service for subscribers for the month of July 2025, including Grounded 2, Wuchang: Fallen Feathers, Wheel World, RoboCop: Rogue City, and more.

Most of the games added to Xbox Game Pass this month aren't available today, as there are a few games launching directly into the service. The only 'new' game of sorts that players can jump into today with Game Pass, is High on Life, which is returning to the service after it was previously available and removed from the service.

Beginning on July 17, RoboCop: Rogue City and My Friendly Neighborhood are added to the service. For RoboCop, its arrival in Game Pass also lines up with the release of its brand new DLC, Unfinished Business, though the DLC is not available in the Game Pass version that subscribers will have access to. You'll still need to grab the DLC separately if you devour the base game before the month is up.

On July 18, RPG Back to the Dawn enters the service, followed by Abiotic Factor launching into Game Pass on July 22. Then on July 23, Wheel World, a new open-world bicycle game is also launching into the service, followed by yet another day-one launch into Game Pass with Wuchang: Fallen Feathers on July 24.

Grounded 2 then launches into early access on Steam and Game Preview on Xbox consoles on July 29, and July's additions are capped off by Farming Simulator 25 joining the service on August 1. Here's the full list of games getting added to Xbox Game Pass for the month of July 2025:

  • High on Life - July 15 (Cloud, Console, PC)
  • RoboCop: Rogue City - July 17 (Cloud, PC, Xbox Series X/S)
  • My Friendly Neighborhood - July 17 (Cloud, Console, PC)
  • Back to the Dawn - July 18 (Cloud, Console, PC)
  • Abiotic Factor - July 22 (Cloud, PC, Xbox Series X/S)
  • Wheel World - July 23 (Cloud, PC, Xbox Series X/S)
  • Wuchang: Fallen Feathers - July 24 (Cloud, PC, Xbox Series X/S)
  • Grounded 2 - July 29 (Cloud, PC, Xbox Series X/S)
  • Farming Simulator 25 - August 1 (Cloud, Console, PC)

Along with this new batch of games entering the service, there are a few games leaving Game Pass as of July 31. It's just three games this time, with Gigantic, Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess, and Turnip Boy Robs a Bank, all leaving the service at the end of the month.
